page.title: 04MOELFRE ISAF
page.content: {Moelfre Isaf}(317 metres) is a prominent landmark in the area. This hilltop was used as a site for one of the chain of beacon fires which were lit across the country to celebrate the wedding of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales and Lady Diana Spencer in 1981. A number of hills and mountains in North Wales were used for this celebration on the evening of the wedding, including Moel Famau to the east and Snowdon to the west. There is a triangulation point situated at the summit of Moelfre Isaf, used for determining the height above sea-level of various landmarks. A small amount of quarrying has been carried out here in the past, but the land is now used for grazing sheep.
